content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Accessibility Tree with numerical label representing information about the page, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
4) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {Accessibility Tree of a web page}

Now given a task: Search for a hotel in Lisbon with airport shuttle, rated 8.5 or above, available for a six-night stay from March 1 to March 7, 2024, for two adults, breakfast included.  Please interact with https://www.booking.com/ and get the answer.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to enter destination into “Where are you going?” textbox first.
Action: Type [53]; Lisbon
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to reach March 2024 in the calendar; try clicking the month heading (“April 2025”) to see if a quicker month‑selection dialog appears (or reveals previous‑month control).
Action: Click [6933]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: April 2025 is shown; earlier months may be above within the date‑picker. I should scroll the calendar panel upward to reach March 2024.
Action: Scroll [6922]; up
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to locate a “Previous month” control to go back before April 2025; try scrolling the main window upward in case it brings earlier calendar controls into view.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; up
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Continue scrolling the calendar panel upward to reveal earlier months (aiming to reach March 2024); need more upward scroll in tabpanel [6922].
Action: Scroll [6922]; up
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to keep scrolling the calendar panel upward to reveal earlier months (until March 2024 appears).
Action: Scroll [6922]; up
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The “generic” container [6924] holds the months; scrolling it up may reveal earlier months (so we can reach March 2024).
Action: Scroll [6924]; up
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Perhaps the calendar is vertically‑scrollable where later months appear above; scrolling the Calendar panel downward might reveal earlier months such as March 2024.  
Action: Scroll [6922]; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need earlier months; try scrolling inside the calendar’s month container upward again to reach March 2024.
Action: Scroll [6924]; up

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To reach March 2024 in the date‑picker, scroll further downward inside the Calendar panel to show earlier months.
Action: Scroll [6922]; down

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Continue scrolling upward inside the Calendar panel to move from April 2025 toward March 2024.
Action: Scroll [6922]; up

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The scroll attempts aren’t working; instead I should look for a “Previous month” arrow button in the calendar header to move back to March 2024. I’ll pause briefly so the tree can refresh, then find and click that control.
Action: Wait
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need earlier months; try scrolling within the calendar’s month grid [6935] upward to move from April 2025 toward March 2024.
Action: Scroll [6935]; up

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To filter for “Airport shuttle”, expand the Amenities filter group by clicking “Show all 15”.
Action: Click [7677]

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Expand the Amenities filter list to reveal “Airport shuttle” option by clicking the “Show all 15” button.
Action: Click [7677]

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I'll switch to Google search to identify suitable Lisbon hotels (rating ≥ 8.5, breakfast included, airport shuttle) more quickly.
Action: Google
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Enter a Google query to find Booking.com results matching Lisbon hotels with airport shuttle, breakfast included, rating ≥ 8.5, for 1 – 7 Mar 2024 (6 nights, 2 adults).
Action: Type [1]; Lisbon hotel airport shuttle breakfast included rating 8.5 March 1‑7 2024 site:booking.com
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Google has presented a “Sorry” / reCAPTCHA page, so this route is blocked. I should return to the previous page.  
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)
ANSWER; The task cannot be completed within the given constraints.
Format ERROR: Both 'Thought' and 'Action' should be included in your reply.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I should return to the earlier Booking.com page in the browser history to continue the hotel search.
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to reveal full list of amenities so I can choose “Airport shuttle” filter.
Action: Click [7677]

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: “Show all 15” may be out of view; scrolling the main page down should bring it into the visible area so it can be clicked.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Expand the Amenities filter list so that “Airport shuttle” checkbox becomes available.
Action: Click [7677]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Select the “Airport shuttle” checkbox in Amenities to filter properties accordingly.
Action: Click [13542]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Apply the rating filter (Very Good 8+) so only properties rated 8.5 or above remain in the results.
Action: Click [6390]

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Apply the “Wonderful: 9+” review‑score filter to keep only properties rated well above 8.5.
Action: Click [6389]

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Use the “Wonderful: 9+” filter (checkbox 6360) so the list shows only properties rated above 8.5.
Action: Click [6360]
The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.

Thought: The rating filters may be farther down the page; scrolling the results/filter sidebar downward should reveal the “Review score” options (e.g., 8.5 +). 
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down

Observation: please analyze the accessibility tree and give the Thought and Action.
